author: Charles Dickens
content: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
name: Charles Dickens
bio: Charles John Huffam Dickens  (7 February 1812 â€“ 9 June 1870) was an English writer and social critic. He created some of the world's best-known fictional characters and is regarded by many as the greatest novelist of the Victorian era.

quotes.content: Don't leave a stone unturned. It's always something, to know you have done the most you could.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.content: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens
Charles Dickens
quotes.content: We need never be ashamed of our tears.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.content: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.content: Minds, like bodies, will often fall into a pimpled, ill-conditioned state from mere excess of comfort.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.content: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.content: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.content: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.

quotes.author: Charles Dickens
quotes.content: Subdue your appetites, my dears, and you've conquered human nature.
